content.question: A ball is released from rest from the twentieth <math alttext="floor" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floor</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a building. After <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the ball has fallen one <math alttext="floor" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floor</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> such that it is directly outside the nineteenth-<math alttext="floor" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floor</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> window. The <math alttext="floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are evenly spaced. Assume air resistance is negligible. What is the number of <math alttext="floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> the ball would fall in <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> after it is released from the twentieth <math alttext="floor" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>floor</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></math> or less

<math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="6 floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="10 floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></math>
<math alttext="11 floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>11</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></math> or more

content.answer: <math alttext="7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="10 floors" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>floors</mtext></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
